title: Compression by replacing TH  and IS with characters

content.question: Which of the following statements about byte pair encoding is true?

choices.label: Byte pair encoding is an example of a lossy transformation because it discards some of the data in the original string.
Byte pair encoding is an example of a lossy transformation because some pairs of characters are replaced by a single character.
Byte pair encoding is an example of a lossless transformation because an encoded string can be restored to its original version.
Byte pair encoding is an example of a lossless transformation because it can be used to transmit messages securely.

content.answer: Byte pair encoding is an example of a lossless transformation because an encoded string can be restored to its original version.
